Recall that a \emph{linear} approximation involves finding the equation

hints_raw: Recall that a ''linear'' approximation involves finding the equation of the ''tangent line'' to <math> \displaystyle f</math> at the point <math> a=1</math>.
question: 1 (i)
sols_html:
To solve this question, we begin by finding the equation of the tangent line to the function \(\displaystyle f(x) = \ln(x)\). Differentiating gives us \(f'(x) = \frac1{x}\) and plugging in \(\displaystyle a=1\) we obtain the \(y\) value of \(\displaystyle y = \ln(1) = 0\). Using the point slope formula, we have at the point \(\displaystyle (1,0)\)

\(\displaystyle \frac{y-0}{x-1} = 1\)

Solving gives

\(\displaystyle y = x-1\)

Thus, the approximation we seek is given by

\(\displaystyle y = 1.25-1 = 0.25\).
